materials.raw_text:
Acetate Cadmium (Ac2): 25 grams 
 Cadmium (Cd2): 20 grams 
 Lead (Pb2): 40 grams 
 Praseodymium (Pr2): 15 grams 
 Zinc (Zn8): 80 grams

sourcing.instructions:
Acetate Cadmium can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online marketplaces specializing in laboratory materials. 
 Cadmium may be available through metal suppliers or chemical providers. 
 Lead can be found at hardware stores or through specialized metal suppliers. 
 Praseodymium is typically available from chemical retailers or online suppliers. 
 Zinc can be purchased at hardware stores, metal suppliers, or chemical distributors.

1. In a clean, dry mixing container, add 25 grams of Acetate Cadmium.
2. Gradually add 20 grams of Cadmium while stirring continuously.
3. Slowly incorporate 40 grams of Lead into the mixture.
4. Add 15 grams of Praseodymium, ensuring an even distribution.
5. Finally, mix in 80 grams of Zinc, stirring thoroughly until the mixture is homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean, dry mixing container, add 25 grams of Acetate Cadmium. 
 2. Gradually add 20 grams of Cadmium while stirring continuously. 
 3. Slowly incorporate 40 grams of Lead into the mixture. 
 4. Add 15 grams of Praseodymium, ensuring an even distribution. 
 5. Finally, mix in 80 grams of Zinc, stirring thoroughly until the mixture is homogeneous.
